subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Where's everyone gone?
msgSnippet: ... An alternative is to use pfaedit to convert the truetype font to a pfa font. ... -- Josh Cogliati jjc@honors.montana.edu This message created in Linux, the
messageBody:
On Mon, Jun 24, 2002 at 10:19:05AM +0100, Michael Fitzgerald wrote:
> Hi Paige,
>
> >I believe I have to get some
> > type of program to
> > permit Linux to work with the truetype fonts.
An alternative is to use pfaedit to convert the truetype font
to a pfa font.

> Do you need to work on a doc in both Word and Linux?
> If you complete a doc in Word and then convert to
> either .pdf or .html Linux should be able to handle
> these, at least to be able to see and upload them.

--
Josh Cogliati
jjc@...
This message created in Linux, the choice of a GNU generation.
